Reviews.Title: “Good base for Tours of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have used this hotel for the last 7 years as as base for the Christmas markets and gerneral touring of Berlin. Main train/s bann and bus 5 mins from hotel. Spandau has agreat christmas market and hotel is attached to a big shopping mall. Staff are great and will assit with any and all requests. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wish to tour Berlin at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Kari”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with my family and when tour are buying the car. Big chopping center near and easy train to city of berlin. Nice christmas area. Car parking to nearest chopping center 10e/day, inside the hotel building.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for an early start on the ICE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be by Spandau station for a quick getaway West - it couldnt be nearer! - the town (and Citadel) is interesting but central Berlin is 20-30 minutes away by S-bahn so not so good for sightseeing. Perhaps the best Ibis room we've stayed in (plus wonderful view as on 10th floor). Nnice Italian restaurant just over the traffic lights.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ibis Berlin Spandau – convenient, friendly and value for money”
Reviews.Author: wmlewis
Reviews.Content: We were travelling by train and arriving in Berlin late at Berlin Spandau, so decided on the Ibis (having stayed in them before in other countries and finding them very suitable for a one night stay). The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was perfectly adequate, and we only paid something like 33 euro for one night, so it was a bargain. It was very near the train station, so was very convenient after a long train trip to access. Definitely recommended for a value for money stay if you’re in this part of town for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we(couple) stay here for three days and only pay 39euro per day, it worth every money, however, you have to pay extra money for wifi

Reviews.Title: “If you have any luggage at all don't book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: john6101953
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights whilst visiting Berlin Christmas markets, what a disaster. The only parking is on the shopping centre's huge car park and you cannot get within a twenty minute walk of the hotel, that's if you can find your way there from the car park. The staff were the most unhelpful I have ever met and although the receptionist had a badge saying that she spoke English, she could not understand the simplest of questions. Towels were not changed on the second day so when we came from a day in the city we had dirty towels, not a hotel I would recommend to anyone, even if you had a taxi to the hotel there is nowhere for the taxi to park while you unloaded lugagge.

Reviews.Title: “Recomend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This chain in general is highly recommended. I have always had good experiences on them (except in Milan). Excellent quality/price rate

Reviews.Title: “Worth for staying”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient, close to rail station, good for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: UnclePaulie
Reviews.Content: I love Berlin and visit there every one or two years. And we (or sometimes just myself) always stay at the Ibis Spandau where you're only steps away from the S-Bahn and U-Bahn stations (and a big mall, too). Walk a couple of blocks beyond and you're in Spandau's pleasant Altstadt (Oldtown) where there are restraunts and bakeries. Although Spandau is in the far-west of the Berlin municipality, the S-Bahn trains run frequent and will get you to the center in less than 30 minutes. Access to Tegel (TXL) Airport requires a transfer from the U7 to a bus but can also be done in less than 30 minutes. Regional DB trains run hourly direct to Schönefeld (SXF) Airport but that takes an hour. The hotel itself is the usual clean/modern Ibis with slightly larger bathrooms. The elevators come quickly. By booking ahead thru Accor/Ibis I got my room for this most recent visit for €49 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location right next to the Spandau Aracden mall and the Train station”
Reviews.Author: Rizes
Reviews.Content: This is a value for money place. At 65 euros a day for a very spacious twin room,it's a real bargain.There are not many staff.The breakfast if for 9 euros.It's a very very complete breakfast and is healthy and tasty at the same time.The menu is rich. It's a branch of ACCORHOTELS and is very reliable.They have branches at all the places. And there is a plan for regular customers by virtue of which you can get good discount at all the branches.The staff is well-trained,well oriented and very helpful with any query you might have.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: BandiB
Reviews.Content: Although a little way from the centre of Berlin the hotel is very close to the rail station and trains take as little as 10 minutes to the centre. However the price makes it worthwhile to stay out here. You can also explore Spandau on foot and there are plenty of eating drinking options close by. Standard Ibis hotel in terms on interior and facilities.
